inputs.name: Textbox
inputs.doc: Component creates a textbox for user to enter input. Provides a string (or number is `type` is "float") as an argument to the wrapped function.
params_doc: number of line rows to provide in textarea.
placeholder hint to provide behind textarea.
default text to provide in textarea.
DEPRECATED. Whether the input should be parsed as a number instead of a string.
Type of value to be returned by component. "str" returns a string, "number" returns a float value.
inputs.interpret: Accepts a list of 2-length tuples. The first element of the tuples is a string representing a string of characters. The second element represents the corresponding interpretation score of the string, from -1 to 1.

inputs.name: Slider
inputs.doc: Component creates a slider that ranges from `minimum` to `maximum`. Provides a number as an argument to the wrapped function.

inputs.name: Checkbox
inputs.doc: Component creates a checkbox that can be set to `True` or `False`. Provides a boolean as an argument to the wrapped function.

inputs.name: CheckboxGroup
inputs.doc: Component creates a set of checkboxes of which a subset can be selected. Provides a list of strings representing the selected choices as an argument to the wrapped function.
params_doc: list of options to select from.
Type of value to be returned by component. "value" returns the list of strings of the choices selected, "index" returns the list of indicies of the choices selected.

inputs.name: Radio
inputs.doc: Component creates a set of radio buttons of which only one can be selected. Provides string representing selected choice as an argument to the wrapped function.
params_doc: list of options to select from.
Type of value to be returned by component. "value" returns the string of the choice selected, "index" returns the index of the choice selected.

inputs.name: Dropdown
inputs.doc: Component creates a dropdown of which only one can be selected. Provides string representing selected choice as an argument to the wrapped function.
params_doc: list of options to select from.
Type of value to be returned by component. "value" returns the string of the choice selected, "index" returns the index of the choice selected.

inputs.name: Image
inputs.doc: Component creates an image upload box with editing capabilities.
params_doc: shape to crop and resize image to; if None, matches input image size.
"RGB" if color, or "L" if black and white.
whether to invert the image as a preprocessing step.

Source of image. "upload" creates a box where user can drop an image file, "webcam" allows user to take snapshot from their webcam, "canvas" defaults to a white image that can be edited and drawn upon with tools.
Tools used for editing. "editor" allows a full screen editor, "select" provides a cropping and zoom tool.

Type of value to be returned by component. "numpy" returns a numpy array with shape (width, height, 3) and values from 0 to 255, "pil" returns a PIL image object, "file" returns a temporary file object whose path can be retrieved by file_obj.name.
inputs.interpret: Accepts a 2D float array, where each value represents the interpretation score of the corresponding pixel in the input image, with a value ranging from -1 to 1.

inputs.name: Audio
params_doc: Source of audio. "upload" creates a box where user can drop an audio file, "microphone" creates a microphone input.

Type of value to be returned by component. "numpy" returns a 2-set tuple with an integer sample_rate and the data numpy.array of shape (samples, 2), "file" returns a temporary file object whose path can be retrieved by file_obj.name, "mfcc" returns the mfcc coefficients of the input audio.

inputs.name: File
params_doc: Type of value to be returned by component. "file" returns a temporary file object whose path can be retrieved by file_obj.name, "binary" returns an bytes object.

inputs.name: Dataframe
inputs.doc: Component accepts 2D input through a spreadsheet interface.
inputs.type: Union[pandas.DataFrame, numpy.array, List[Union[str, float]], List[List[Union[str, float]]]]
params_doc: Limit number of rows for input.
Limit number of columns for input. If equal to 1, return data will be one-dimensional. Ignored if `headers` is provided.
Datatype of values in sheet. Can be provided per column as a list of strings, or for the entire sheet as a single string. Valid datatypes are "str", "number", "bool", and "date".
Type of value to be returned by component. "pandas" for pandas dataframe, "numpy" for numpy array, or "array" for a Python array.

outputs.name: Textbox
outputs.doc: Component creates a textbox to render output text or number.
params_doc: Type of value to be passed to component. "str" expects a string, "number" expects a float value, "auto" detects return type.

outputs.name: Label
outputs.doc: Component outputs a classification label, along with confidence scores of top categories if provided. Confidence scores are represented as a dictionary mapping labels to scores between 0 and 1.
params_doc: number of most confident classes to show.
Type of value to be passed to component. "value" expects a single out label, "confidences" expects a dictionary mapping labels to confidence scores, "auto" detects return type.

outputs.name: Image
params_doc: Type of value to be passed to component. "numpy" expects a numpy array with shape (width, height, 3), "pil" expects a PIL image object, "file" expects a file path to the saved image, "plot" expects a matplotlib.pyplot object, "auto" detects return type.
DEPRECATED. Whether to expect a plot to be returned by the function.

outputs.name: KeyValues
outputs.doc: Component displays a table representing values for multiple fields.

outputs.name: HighlightedText
outputs.doc:
Component creates text that contains spans that are highlighted by category or numerical value.
Output is represent as a list of Tuple pairs, where the first element represents the span of text represented by the tuple, and the second element represents the category or value of the text.
params_doc: Map between category and respective colors

outputs.name: Audio
outputs.doc: Creates an audio player that plays the output audio.
params_doc: Type of value to be passed to component. "numpy" returns a 2-set tuple with an integer sample_rate and the data numpy.array of shape (samples, 2), "file" returns a temporary file path to the saved wav audio file, "auto" detects return type.

outputs.name: JSON
outputs.doc: Used for JSON output. Expects a JSON string or a Python object that is JSON serializable.

outputs.name: HTML
outputs.doc: Used for HTML output. Expects an HTML valid string.

outputs.name: Dataframe
outputs.doc: Component displays 2D output through a spreadsheet interface.
outputs.type: Union[pandas.DataFrame, numpy.array, List[Union[str, float]], List[List[Union[str, float]]]]
params_doc: Type of value to be passed to component. "pandas" for pandas dataframe, "numpy" for numpy array, or "array" for Python array, "auto" detects return type.

interface.doc: Interfaces are created with Gradio using the `gradio.Interface()` function.
params_doc: the function to wrap an interface around.

a single Gradio input component, or list of Gradio input components. Components can either be passed as instantiated objects, or referred to by their string shortcuts. The number of input components should match the number of parameters in fn.

a single Gradio output component, or list of Gradio output components. Components can either be passed as instantiated objects, or referred to by their string shortcuts. The number of output components should match the number of values returned by fn.
whether to print detailed information during launch.

sample inputs for the function; if provided, appears below the UI components and can be used to populate the interface. Should be nested list, in which the outer list consists of samples and each inner list consists of an input corresponding to each input component.
whether the interface should automatically reload on change.
if True, captures the default graph and session (needed for Tensorflow 1.x)
function that provides interpretation explaining prediction output. Pass "default" to use built-in interpreter.
a title for the interface; if provided, appears above the input and output components.
a description for the interface; if provided, appears above the input and output components.
path to image or src to use as display picture for models listed in gradio.app/hub
if False, users will not see a button to take a screenshot of the interface.
if False, users will not see a button to flag an input and output.
what to name the dir where flagged data is stored.
whether to display in the interface inline on python notebooks.
whether to automatically launch the interface in a new tab on the default browser.
whether to create a publicly shareable link from your computer for the interface.
if True, and the interface was launched from Google Colab, prints the errors in the cell output.
